intro: Trianthema decandrum var. rubrum, commonly known as the red-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, bright red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
